name: Pokedex
description: Our loading page is displayed until all our pokemons are loaded. It lasts 5-10 seconds on average.
All available pokemons can be found on this page. You can sort them alphabetically, by type and by ID. You can also add pokemons to your collection by clicking on the pokeball next to their name.
This is where you'll find your pokemon collection. Some information about them, such as name or ID, is available. You can release them by clicking on the Remove button.
When you have a pokemon in your collection, the pokeball next to its name changes as an indication.
This is where you'll find most of the information about each pokemon. You open this page by clicking on the pokemon you want on the Home page. You can find types, stats, ID, description and attacks.

name: AVG Challenge
description: This is the site's landing page. After clicking on the button, you'll be redirected to a Discord login form. Authentication on the site is by Discord and nothing else.
Once you've logged in, you can choose which challenge you'd like to see news about and/or take part in. Below each challenge, you can see whether it's planned, in progress or completed.
This is the main page of the site. This is where you'll find a summary of the chosen challenge and last week's results.
This is a more detailed page of last week's results. You can see the improvement in each player's average score. At the top of the page, you can also see the best and worst score improvements.
If you want to see all the scores achieved since the start of the challenge, this is the place to go. You can sort by alphabetical order, average score or search for a player if you wish.
The problems most frequently encountered by users are listed here, along with their answers.
If you wish to change your name, choose your guild, create a guild if you haven't already done so, or log out, you can do so on the Settings page.
The site has a light/dark mode to suit your preferences.  This will be retained for future connections.
All types of device are supported by the site, whether it's a phone, tablet, laptop or other, the site is responsive.
techno: VueJS, NodeJS, SASS, API DISCORD, AXIOS, ExpressJS, Sequelize

name: Sc@m3rZ
description: Sc@m3rZ is a fake video game marketplace. When you arrive on the site, you'll find all the games in selections such as best rated or recently added.
When we scroll down below the selections, we can find all the games available on the site.

To see the details of a particular game, just click on its image. You can then rent the game, comment on it or rate it. There's a red or green tick to tell you whether you've already rented the game or not.
The green sticker in question.

name: Gourmet
description: We have several images of dishes that you can click on to see the recipes. These are sorted by recommendations or favorites, for example
This is still on the main page, but with a different selection.
Once you've gone through the selections, you can see all the recipes available on the site.
In the navbar, there are different predefined filters. When you click on them, you can see the recipes that have this category.
Once you've clicked on a recipe, you can see all the ingredients needed to make it, as well as the quantities.
Then we can also find the steps to make the recipe perfectly.

name: CarteX
description: This is the home page. There are login buttons and redirections to the marketplace all over the page.
This page is the main page of this site. This is where all the available cards are grouped together.
When you click on the card of your choice, you can see everything on the card.
Here you can see all the people who worked on the project, as well as a brief summary of the project.
This is where you can see all the cards you've created.
On this interface you can create the card you want. The card is updated in real time.
On the booster page, you can simulate a booster opening. You can trigger the opening by clicking on the booster or on the button.
Once you've opened the booster, you can choose the cards you're interested in. After clicking on the 'Ajouté' button, it will be added to your personal collection.
Here you can see all the cards in your personal collection.
techno: ReactJS, NodeJS, PHP, SASS, API YU-GI-OH, AXIOS, ExpressJS

name: MET France
description: I worked on this project during my internship, mainly on the customer account part. I don't have access to a customer account, so I'm posting a few images of the site I do have access to.
The login page is the only page I can go to that I've been working on. I did the responsive as well as the restyle of the buttons
This is the company map to find out where it is available in Europe.

name: Front Clone
description: When I was learning the web, I made a few clones for practice. It was mainly to improve my html css skills with existing designs. For the Spotify clone, this was the first clone I made, and I only made the home page.
For the X clone, it was primarily to understand how the front-end and back-end work and interact. There's a small database and API in this clone.
